Auto-Attack

You will automatically attack an enemy if you
approach them. This is called an auto-attack.

Stand still near an enemy to continue auto-attacking.
An icon confirming you're in range for auto-attacks will
be shown in the bottom-right corner of the screen.
Destinations

An ! will mark your next destination. The number below
it indicates how far away you are from the destination.
How to Begin a Battle

Begin a battle by drawing your weapon. First, target an
enemy, then press [ML:icon icon=btn_a ] to draw your weapon. To withdraw
from battle, hold [ML:icon icon=btn_a ] for a while to sheathe your weapon.

Approach an enemy to automatically target them. If there
are multiple enemies, press [ML:icon icon=btn_l ] or [ML:icon icon=btn_r ] to target a different
enemy.
Arts

Arts are stronger than auto-attacks. They can be
activated by pressing [ML:icon icon=btn_x ], [ML:icon icon=btn_y ] or [ML:icon icon=btn_b ].

After using an Art, you cannot use it again until
its gauge fills back up. The Arts gauges fill up
automatically over time. This is called recharging.
Talent Arts

Talent Arts are stronger than normal Arts. A Talent Art
can be activated by pressing [ML:icon icon=btn_a ] once its circular gauge
is full.

A Talent Art's gauge is recharged by performing actions
expected of a character's role, also called "Role Actions".

Noah's role in this battle is as an Attacker. Using Edge
Thrust from behind an enemy is what is expected of an
Attacker, so doing so will recharge Noah's Talent Art.
Aggro

Accumulating aggro will draw an enemy's attention
toward you. Using strong attacks and healing Arts will
accumulate a lot of aggro, so keep that in mind.

If an ally is under attack and at risk of becoming
incapacitated, a good tactic is to accumulate aggro
toward yourself so they can continue fighting.
Targeting Lines
Targeting Lines 2
Targeting Lines 3

To show you which of your characters are being attacked
by enemies, a red or blue thread will connect the enemy
and the character they're attacking: the targeting line.

When the character is an Attacker or Healer, the line is red.
Unlike Defenders, defense isn't their strong suit, so it's your
cue to be careful.

A blue line indicates the enemy's target is a Defender.
Defenders specialize in taking enemy attention and attacks,
so they should do just fine in this situation.
Art Combos

Landing certain Arts one after another in a set order is
called a combo. Only Arts with special status effects can
start a combo.

For example, an Art that inflicts Break followed by an
Art that inflicts Topple will topple an enemy. A longer
combo is Break > Topple > Daze > Burst.
The Combo Gauge

The combo gauge will appear when you start a combo.
Performing the next attack in a combo before the gauge
runs out will continue that combo.
Combos: Launch Attacks

While an enemy is Toppled, hit them with an Art that
has the Launch reaction. For the duration, all attacks will
be guaranteed to hit, as well as dealing greater damage.
Combos: Daze Attacks

While an enemy is Toppled, hit them with an Art that
has the Daze reaction. For the duration, all attacks will
be guaranteed to hit and will not generate any aggro.
The Smash Combo

While an enemy is Launched, hit them with an Art that
has the Smash reaction to smash them back to the
ground, dealing massive damage.
The Burst Combo

While an enemy is Dazed, hit them with an Art that
has the Burst reaction to purge their rage status
and increase the number of items they'll drop.
How Attackers Fight
Noah's class, Swordfighter, plays the Attacker role.

Attack the enemy from the side or back while a
Defender has their attention. Being extra aware
of your positioning in a battle is crucial.
How Healers Fight

Eunie takes the Healer role, and her class is Medic
Gunner.

Healers play an extremely important role as they can
restore hit points (HP), revive incapacitated allies and
provide various other means of support.
How Defenders Fight
Mio takes the Defender role, and her class is Zephyr.

Defenders draw an enemy's Aggro toward themselves
to prevent their allies from being attacked. Use guard
and evasion Arts to reduce the damage you take.
Arts Recharge Differences

Classes from Keves and Agnus recharge their
Arts gauges in different ways.

Kevesi classes' Arts gauges fill over time.
Agnian classes' Arts gauges fill by auto-attacking.
Noah's team belongs to Keves, and Mio's, to Agnus.

For Agnian classes, canceling auto-attacks into Arts will
boost the recharge quicker. Use this to your advantage!
Mastering Arts
Fusion Arts

Fusion Arts let you use a Class Art fused with its paired
Master Art's effects when both are recharged. Hold [ML:icon icon=btn_zr ]
and press a Class Art button to use the Fusion Art.
Chain Attack

Performing combos, Art canceling, and Role Actions will
fill up the chain gauge. Once the gauge is full, press [ML:icon icon=btn_plus ]
to launch a Chain Attack.

Once a Chain Attack begins, Chain Order plates display
showing different orders for you to follow, allowing you
to compare the plates' role icons with your party setup.

When you have chosen an order, you will then choose a
character who will attack. Choose characters with the
same roles as shown on the plate icons for best results.

Selecting a character with the same role icon as on the
plate will display a tick. Select a character with the
wrong role icon, and you'll see an X-mark instead.

Each Chain Order requires three attacks. If each of the
three attacks correspond with the plate's role icons, and
in the correct order, a Chain Art will be activated.

Once one order has finished, you will have the choice of
selecting another order. You may sometimes be able to
select the same characters again in the next Chain Order.
Ouroboros Order

If during a Chain Attack you complete orders from a pair
of Ouroboros partners, an Ouroboros Order will become
available, allowing you to deal even bigger damage.
Interlink

Press [ML:icon icon=btn_left ] to have the character you're controlling
Interlink with their partner. The Ouroboros form
is both resilient and powerful.
How Ouroboros Fight

While two characters are Interlinked, you can use
Ouroboros Arts as much as you want. But be aware
that the heat gauge will fill up over time.

If the heat gauge fills up all the way, the Interlink will be
canceled, leaving you unable to Interlink for a while.
You can cancel an Interlink at any time by pressing [ML:icon icon=pad_down ].
Interlink Levels

Using Fusion Arts lets you strengthen the Ouroboros,
stage by stage. There are three increasingly powerful
stages in total, indicated by the Interlink Level.

Using Fusion Arts to raise the Interlink Level before
engaging the Interlink will allow you to enter the
Ouroboros form in a powered-up state.
Ouroboros Switching

Press [ML:icon icon=pad_up ] while Interlinked to switch to the other partner's
Ouroboros form.
Noah's Special Talent Art

Infinity Blade is Noah's unique Talent Art that he can
equip regardless of his class. It lets him unsheathe
Lucky Seven to deal damage that bypasses defense.
Lucky Seven's Arts

Noah has acquired the "Unlimited Sword" Talent Art.
"Unlimited Sword" is a special Talent Art that can be
used even outside of the Swordfighter class.

"Unlimited Sword" unlocks Lucky Seven's power, briefly
powering up all Arts.
Enemy Rage Status

Enemies with a rage threshold on their HP gauge will turn
enraged when their HP drops below that threshold, raising
attack and changing the behavior pattern. Be very careful!
Field Placement Arts

Field placement Arts allow you to put down fields
which confer various effects to those within range.
The range and duration differ from Art to Art.
Fighting Tactically

Hold down [ML:icon icon=btn_zl ] to display the tactics palette.
You can then use [ML:icon icon=btn_key_pad ] to issue orders to your allies.
Focusing Attacks

Holding [ML:icon icon=btn_zl ] and pressing [ML:icon icon=pad_up ] orders the party to focus
their attacks. Doing this causes other party members
to attack the same target as the controlled character.
Follow Leader / Disperse

Hold [ML:icon icon=btn_zl ] and press [ML:icon icon=pad_down ] to order the party to gather around the
controlled character. Press [ML:icon icon=btn_zl ] + [ML:icon icon=pad_down ] again to have the party
scatter. (Members won't use Arts or attack while gathered.)
Training Drills

You can review previous tutorials by going to System >
Training Drills in the main menu. The drills will allow
you to go over anything you may have missed initially.
Noah's Class

Class: Swordfighter - Role: Attacker. Provides a balance
of abilities, good for unique monster and boss fights. Be
aware of positioning and start combos with Break Arts.
Ethel's Class

Class: Flash Fencer - Role: Attacker. Using buff Arts is
advised before deploying other Arts. Talent Art raises
the Attack power, so make sure to perform Role Actions.
Riku & Manana's Class

Class: Yumsmith - Role: Attacker
Combines offense and AOE support. Use Damage Link
to effectively deal with multiple foes.
Nagiri's Class

Class: Machine Assassin - Role: Attacker.
Weakens enemies to raise damage.
Extend debuffs to weaken all enemies.
Gray's Class

Class: Full Metal Jaguar - Role: Attacker
Shots grow deadlier with each consecutive hit.
Time Arts to enemy attacks to rack up the hits.
Melia's Class

Class: Royal Summoner - Role: Attacker
Commands three different elements. Use their Talent Art
after summoning elemental attacks for great damage.
Sena's Class

Class: Crusher - Role: Attacker. Has powerful solo attacks.
Can nullify an enemy's guard with their Stance Art. Pivot
to offense only after a Defender has the enemy's aggro.
Niina's Class

Class: Attack Knight - Role: Attacker
Damage increases with each critical hit, but beware,
as the damage bonus resets upon incapacitation.
Yuzuriha's Class

Class: Phantom Archer - Role: Attacker. Deals low damage to
individual targets, but excels at managing aggro. Work
with allies to make good use of the Art Follow-Up fields.
Kamunabi's Class

Class: Warrior - Role: Attacker
Becomes more powerful with each hit taken. Utilize
self-damaging Arts to maintain high attack power.
Ghondor's Class

Class: Martial Artist - Role: Attacker
Can accelerate Art recharge speed. Their Talent Art
consumes the charge from all Arts to deal big damage.
Triden's Class

Class: Soulhacker - Role: Attacker
Can acquire Arts and skills from unique monsters,
allowing for a wide range of battle customization.

Triden himself wields some unique Arts and skills, with
various ways to raise his Attack, making him an explosive
Attacker indeed.

However, he's also mostly forgotten the various moves
he's obtained over the years, leaving him only with those
Arts and skills that he used most regularly.
Eunie's Class

Class: Medic Gunner - Role: Healer
Specializes in Field Arts. Their Talent Art can heal
allies over a large area without accumulating aggro.
Rudi's Class

Class: War Medic - Role: Healer
Boasts incredible healing ability. With one in the party,
your medical needs are all but guaranteed to be met.
Taion's Class

Class: Tactician - Role: Healer. Can use Arts that inflict
Sleep and increase Evasion. Supports the party by
debuffing enemies, and mitigating damage with Evasion.
Isurugi's Class

Class: Strategist - Role: Healer
Possesses Arts that heal allies and weaken enemies.
A highly versatile class with many aces up their sleeve.
Teach's Class

Class: Alchemist - Role: Healer. Has both healing
and offensive options. Aim to keep allies healed during
a combo with an Art that uses Armor Veil.
Mashiro's Class

Class: Aries - Role: Healer
A unique Healer that applies random buffs to allies,
and can strengthen the whole party with Arts.
Miyabi's Class

Class: Gagaku Performer - Role: Healer. A unique Healer
that can speed up allies' Art recharge speed. Their
Talent Art fully recharges every Art of every ally.
Nia's Class

Class: Life Shrine Maiden - Role: Healer. The strongest of the
Healer classes, able to support the entire party. Heals
allies while dealing defense-ignoring damage to enemies.
Lanz's Class

Class: Heavy Guard - Role: Defender
Uses attacks that build plenty of aggro, and can take
many hits, making this class perfect for defending allies.
Zeon's Class

Class: Guardian Commander - Role: Defender
Great at protecting allies about to be incapacitated.
Their Talent Art absorbs attacks to gain extra power.
Ashera's Class

Class: Lone Exile - Role: Defender
Accumulates heavy aggro through attacks. Can also
counterattack when an ally in range has been attacked.
Mio's Class

Class: Zephyr - Role: Defender. Excels in Evasion Arts,
and can counter upon evading an enemy's attack. Can
also block and nullify attacks on nearby allies.
Monica's Class

Class: Lost Vanguard - Role: Defender. Protects allies
by deploying fields. Specializes in countering enemy
attacks, and can deal damage while guarding.
A Special Level-Up Method

You usually increase levels through EXP gained in battle,
but by selecting "Level Up" at a rest spot, you can use
bonus EXP to increase your characters' levels.
Raising Class Rank

Earn enough Class Points (CP) through battle, and
the class's rank will increase. You can also obtain
class ranks by spending Nopon Coins.

Each class comes with one Art mastered from the start,
but to master the other Arts, skills, Talent Arts etc.,
you'll need to raise the class rank sufficiently.

Class ranks are normally capped at rank 10, but by
completing certain quests, you can unlock the ability
to increase the rank beyond that limit.
Powering Up Ouroboros

In the main menu, go to Characters > Interlink > Soul Tree,
to access a menu where you can spend the SP you earned
in battle to upgrade the character's Ouroboros form.
Personal Accessories

You can strengthen character-specific accessories at
rest spots from the "Strengthen Accessories" menu.
Origin Shards

Within the City, you'll find Samon's workshop.
Hand over Origin Shards to the legendary Nopon smiths,
of whom there are seven, to improve your weapons.
Setting up Arts

You can set up a character's Arts by going to
Characters > Arts in the main menu.
Equipping Accessories

You can equip accessories via Characters > Accessories
in the main menu. Accessories help to strengthen your
characters in various ways.
Changing Classes

Go to Characters > Class to change a character's class.
Every class has its quirks and characteristics, so be sure
to play around with as many as you can.

Upon winning a battle, you will receive Class Points (CP)
that will increase your Class Rank. The quickest way to
increase Class Rank is to continually use one class.
Master Art Settings

Go to Characters > Arts in the main menu to set up a
character's Master Arts.

By raising the rank of a character's class, you can
eventually master that class's Arts. If you switch to another
class, you can set those Arts into Master Art sub-slots.

The number of available sub-slots will increase as your
characters gain levels. Also note that Kevesi classes can
only set Agnian class Arts as Master Arts, and vice versa.
Crafting Gems

At rest spots, you can use items to craft gems. They
can have a number of beneficial effects for characters
when equipped on them, so craft as many as you can!

At rest spots, you can use items to craft gems. They
can have a number of beneficial effects for characters
when equipped on them, so craft as many as you can!
Equipping Gems

Once crafted, gems can be equipped by any number of
party members, via Characters > Gems in the main menu.

As your characters gain levels, they'll eventually be able to
equip up to a total of three gems. Each gem grants a unique
effect; customize them as suits your role and battle style!
Changing Player Character

Press [ML:icon icon=btn_l ]/[ML:icon icon=btn_r ] while holding [ML:icon icon=btn_zl ] to switch control between
the characters in your party. This can be done while
exploring the world or while in battle.
Appearance

Go to Characters > Clothing in the main menu
to change how the characters appear in-game.
Class equipment unlocks for cosmetic use at rank 10.

With some equipment, your current class's weapon may
not appear.
Heroes

There are special characters called Heroes who can
join the party. Heroes can travel with you, albeit in some
cases only temporarily, and fight by your side.
Recruiting Heroes Officially

Complete a Hero's Hero Quest to have them permanently
join the party. Deepen your affinity with a Hero to allow
your main party members free use of that Hero's class.
Changing Heroes

Only one Hero can be in your party at a time. Go to
Heroes in the main menu whenever you want to
switch out Heroes.
Hero Accessories

You can set your Heroes' accessories from
Characters > Accessories in the main menu.
Containers in the Field

You may chance upon containers while exploring. Inside,
you can sometimes find items that are otherwise hard to
come by, so it's worth going out of your way to open them.
Soldier Husks

Noah is an off-seer, a soldier who helps the fallen pass
on. Sending off any husks you find on the field will
build your affinity with the colonies they belonged to.
Collectibles

Collectibles are items you can pick up on the field. They
are needed for completing quests and Collectopaedia
Card requests.
Supply Drops

Supply containers, air-dropped from each army's HQ at
the Castles, contain many valuable items. It's always worth
looking out for the red smoke marking their landing sites.

If the player character notices a supply drop nearby,
you can hold [ML:icon icon=btn_zr ] to check its location.
Luring Enemies

Enemies that are close together tend to attack in groups.
In such cases, press [ML:icon icon=btn_up ] to lure over a single enemy from
a group at a time, and gradually pick them off that way.
Ether Channels

On the field, there are green light sources called ether
channels. Using them to fill up ether cylinders will come
in handy for your adventure, so be sure to harvest them!

Press [ML:icon icon=btn_a ] while near an ether channel to harvest its ether
into an ether cylinder.
Fabricators

Each Ferronis Hulk has a Fabricator nearby, which can be
made to manufacture collectibles by spending G. They
can make very rare and difficult-to-acquire items.
Viewing Quest Information

Press [ML:icon icon=btn_y ] to check the current objective of your current
active quest.
Gathering Info

All across Aionios, you will find "[ML:icon icon=icon_info ]" icons. Look
near them for info that could be useful on your
travels. Be sure to check any you happen to find.
Discussing Gathered Info

After gathering info, go to a rest spot and select
"Discuss" for a chance to discuss it. In some cases,
these discussions will trigger new quest developments.
Following Footprints

In certain quests, characters will leave behind footprints
that can be followed. Pay close attention to the ground
and follow where they lead.
Collectopaedia Cards

From Quests in the main menu, go to the Collectopaedia
Card tab to check what someone needs. Helping them
out will deepen your affinity, and give you rewards.
Registering Collectibles

After gathering the required collectibles, go to
Quests > Collectopaedia Cards in the main menu
and hold [ML:icon icon=btn_a ] to register them and complete the quest.
Directing Combo Routes

After Toppling an enemy, the combo route branches into
the Smash (damage-focused) and Burst (effect-focused)
routes. Use [ML:icon icon=btn_zl ] + [ML:icon icon=pad_left ] to direct your party down a route.
Liberating Colonies

Destroying a colony's Flame Clock will liberate it from
the Consul's grasp. Once liberated, the people are free to
act how they like, opening up new info fragments to find.
Bonding Level

Solving colony folks' problems will deepen your affinity
with them. This can be done by completing quests, filling
Collectopaedia Card requests, etc.
The Bonding Chart

You can check how various people in a colony get along
with each other by using the Bonding Chart. It also shows
you a basic profile for each person.
Monster Categories

Monsters are split into four categories: normal, elite,
unique, and lucky. You can tell them apart by looking at
the symbol displayed next to their level indicator.

Normal monsters: Enemies that don't require much
of a strategy in order to defeat, so long as you're
of a similar level to them.

Lucky monsters: Enemies that you'll be lucky to find out
on the field. They're as strong as normal monsters, but
will give out far better rewards when defeated.

Elite monsters: Enemies that are formidable for their
level. Great for challenging yourself once you feel a
little more used to the battle system.

Unique monsters: Incredibly strong foes that are very
challenging, even when you're at their level. Going in
without a sound strategy will not get you very far.
Nopon Coins

Nopon Coins can be traded for items at Nopon Coin
X-changes. They can also be used for Collectopaedia
requests, cooking, gem crafting, and leveling up classes.

In normal shops, they can even be used in place of G,
making it a rather nifty currency.
Cooking and Eating

Eating Manana's meals at a rest spot can temporarily
increase the EXP and rewards you receive from
winning battles.

Some rest spots are canteens where you can order food.
Doing so will help Manana come up with new recipes
that will offer new status effects, so get ordering!
Bonding Bonuses

Raising your affinity with a colony grants affinity bonuses
that make your adventure easier. Go to Party Skills > 
Bonding Bonuses to see the bonuses you have unlocked.
Wall Climbing

This is a traversal skill that Rudi taught the party. It lets
you climb up walls even without the use of ladders.
Rope Sliding

This is a traversal skill that Yuzuriha taught the party. It lets
you grind on ropes set up on the field, allowing you
to descend smoothly and quickly from high places.
Scree Walking

This is a traversal skill that Shidou taught the party.
It lets you move up certain slopes without sliding down.
Hazard Neutralization

This is a traversal skill that Nagiri taught the party.
It allows you to run over poisonous surfaces
without taking damage.
Landmarks

There are places across the world that will give you EXP
once found. Key locations are called Landmarks, and the
especially difficult-to-find ones are called Secret Areas.

When the whole party has been incapacitated in battle,
you will return to the last Landmark you passed by.
Quest Updates

A quest will update when you have made progress in it.
Press [ML:icon icon=pad_left_right ] to switch quest category.
Mini-Map

The mini-map is displayed at the top right of the screen.
It displays the characters' immediate surroundings and
quest destinations. Press [ML:icon icon=btn_r_stick_on ] to display a bigger map.
Piloting the Boundary

Press [ML:icon icon=btn_a ] near the Boundary to board it. Accelerate with
[ML:icon icon=btn_zr ], reverse with [ML:icon icon=btn_b ], and turn with [ML:icon icon=btn_l_stick ]. Hold [ML:icon icon=btn_a ] to
disembark anywhere, at any time.

Go to System > Control Guide in the main menu for a
more detailed guide to the controls.
Piloting the Bravery

Press [ML:icon icon=btn_l_stick_on ] while piloting the Bravery to engage
high-velocity mode. Press [ML:icon icon=btn_l_stick_on ] again to return to
regular mode.
Skip Travel

In the map, accessible from the main menu, use
Skip Travel to instantly travel to any discovered
Landmarks or Secret Areas.
Changing the Time

Go to System > Change Time in the main menu to
change the time of day to whenever you want it to be.
Placing Markers

While navigating the map, you can place a custom
marker anywhere you want by pressing [ML:icon icon=btn_y ], making
any favorite locations easier to find.

An icon will be displayed on the field, guiding you to
where the marker was set, so whenever there's a place
you want to go to, make sure to use this feature.
Menu Shortcuts

Hold [ML:icon icon=btn_zl ] to bring up the Shortcut Palette. Pressing [ML:icon icon=btn_a ]/[ML:icon icon=btn_b ]/
[ML:icon icon=btn_x ]/[ML:icon icon=btn_y ] while holding [ML:icon icon=btn_zl ] will give one-button access to
useful features.

Pressing [ML:icon icon=btn_plus ] while holding [ML:icon icon=btn_zl ] will bring up a separate
shortcut customization screen. Make sure to select
shortcuts that you will use often.
Positioning in Battle

When your allies have an enemy's attention, it's time to
get yourself into a good combat position. Use Arts from
the side or back when an enemy isn't targeting you.
Back Attacks

Certain Arts' effects will change based on your position
relative to an enemy. Optimizing your position will reap
positive effects, like increased damage with back attacks.
Rest Spots

At rest spots, you can perform actions such as leveling
up characters with bonus EXP, or saving the game. You
can also go to any spots you've found using Skip Travel.

The amount of things you can do at rest spots will
increase as you progress the story.
Purchasing Items

Items are purchased with G (gold) in shops.
Items can also be sold for G in shops.
The Flame Clock

The Flame Clock shows the amount of life's flames
harvested from defeated enemies. The amount of flame
will decrease as time passes.

Your characters' stats will increase as the Flame Clock
gauge fills up, so try to keep the gauge filled up as much
as possible to maintain the stat increases.
Sell-Only Items

An item that has a scales icon on it is a sell-only item.
Their only use is to be sold, so gather as many of them
as you can to save lots of G for what you want to buy.
Area of Effect Healing

Eunie's Healing Ring casts a green healing aura
that remains on the ground. Characters standing
within the aura will gradually recover HP.
Navigation

Press [ML:icon icon=btn_zl ] + [ML:icon icon=btn_y ] whenever you need navigational assistance.
Doing so will display the shortest route to your destination.

Be advised however - the shortest route may sometimes
take you past tough enemies, so it's not necessarily the
best or easiest one. Try various routes for best effect.
Rebooting Ferronis Hulks

Throughout Aionios, you will find decrepit Ferronis hulks
lying around. They can be rebooted with the use of some
ether cylinders.

A rebooted Ferronis can manufacture items with its
Fabricator. It will also have containers which conceal
hard-to-get items, and can even be used as a rest spot.
Moebius Warning Level

The Keves and Agnus warning levels have combined to
form a single Moebius warning level.
Checking Controls

Go to System > Control Guide in the main menu to go
over and check the various controls used throughout
the game.
Skirmishes

Across Aionios, you will find groups of enemies fighting
each other. You can engage in these battles by choosing
a side to back up. Winning can result in special rewards.
Auto-Selling Items

Sell-only items will be automatically sold to Shillshill
the Nopon trader as you acquire them. (If you can't
carry any more money, they'll simply disappear.)
Warning Level

Every time a colony is liberated, the warning level of its
nation, Keves or Agnus, will increase. The warning level
for each nation can be checked in the main menu.

As the threat level increases, so too will the number of
soldiers from each nation deployed on the field.
Changing the Active Quest

When a quest is active, its destination will be
marked on-screen with an ! mark. Press [ML:icon icon=btn_y ]
to view an active quest's current objective.

If you have no active quests when a new one triggers, it will
be auto-activated. Otherwise, you can activate it with [ML:icon icon=btn_y ].
(You can toggle quest auto-activation in Options > Game.)

In Quests in the main menu, select a quest from the list,
then press [ML:icon icon=btn_y ] to register it as an active quest.
Refighting Unique Monsters

Once you have defeated a unique monster, they
will leave behind a grave. Check the grave with [ML:icon icon=btn_a ],
and you'll be able to fight the monster again.
Freedom from the Clock

By gaining the power of Ouroboros, the party
were freed from the shackles of the Flame Clock.
Soul Link

On the Soul Tree screen, there are abilities that can be
shared between Interlinking partners. Choose a slot, then
set the ability you want to share between partners.
Discussing Info

Listen to people's conversations on your travels to
acquire info fragments. Once you find enough, they can
be discussed with fellow party members at rest spots.
Liberating Colonies

Destroying a colony's Flame Clock will liberate them from
their Consul's grasp. Doing so will deepen your affinity
with colony citizens and give you useful affinity bonuses.
Enemy Ecology

When enemies perform certain actions, you will see a
red ! icon displayed: they might drop items or cause
rare enemies to appear. It pays to stay observant!
Enemy Area Effects

Some enemies will place markers on the ground that
have an area of effect, displayed in red. Staying inside
the area will cause debuffs or damage, so be careful.
Background Lineup

On the Options screen, access "Background Lineup" to
change how characters will appear in the background of
the main menu.
About Attachments

In the main menu, you can go to Characters > Clothing
to equip attachments, which can partially change
a character's appearance.
Item Rarity

Items have different rarities. From high to low, they are:
Legendary (purple), Rare (yellow) and Common (white).
The rarer the item, the harder it is to come by.
Unknown Trick Devices

Some doors are fitted with special trick locks
and will only open if you can solve their puzzle.

Use [ML:icon icon=btn_l ] and [ML:icon icon=btn_r ] to turn the left and right eyes.
The objective of the puzzle is to get a red piece
onto each of the green spaces.
Attackers' Role Actions
Attackers' Role Actions 2

If you can meet the requirements for Arts that give
bonus effects for positioning, your Talent Art icon will
flash red, and your Talent Art gauge will charge up a lot.

Actions that deal damage effectively, such as dealing
critical hits or participating in combos, also count as
Role Actions, charging your Talent Art gauge bit by bit.
Healers' Role Actions
Healers' Role Actions 2

Using Arts that place field effects on the battlefield
will cause the Talent Art icon to flash green, and your
Talent Art gauge will charge up a lot.

Actions that support your allies, such as applying buffs,
removing debuffs, or raising fallen allies, also count as
Role Actions, charging your Talent Art gauge bit by bit.
Defenders' Role Actions
Defenders' Role Actions 2

Whenever you draw enemy attention to yourself, your
Talent Art icon will flash blue, and your Talent Art
gauge will charge up a lot.

Actions which interfere with enemy attacks, like blocking,
evading, or interrupting them with reactions, also count
as Role Actions, charging your Talent Art gauge bit by bit.
Auto-Saving

This game features an auto-saving function. When you
see "Auto-Saving" displayed in the bottom-right, do not
turn off the console.

You can turn auto saving on or off by going to the
main menu > System > Options > Game and
toggling the Auto-Saving option as desired.

You can also select the save data created by auto-saving
in the Load Game menu on the title screen.
Basic Stats
List of Buffs
List of Debuffs
Enemy Types
Party Interlink Controls

You can change Interlink controls from Options > Game.
Choose "Player" to control Interlinking for the controlled
character directly, or "Party" to control the whole team.

Press [ML:icon icon=pad_left ] to display the Interlink menu. You can then
use [ML:icon icon=pad_up ]/[ML:icon icon=pad_right ]/[ML:icon icon=pad_down ] and [ML:icon icon=btn_x ]/[ML:icon icon=btn_y ]/[ML:icon icon=btn_b ] to order an Interlink.
Press [ML:icon icon=pad_left ] again to hide the menu.

You can use [ML:icon icon=btn_a ] to toggle Interlinking between automatic
and manual. When it's set to automatic, your allies will
automatically Interlink whenever they judge it best.
Quick Move

Press [ML:icon icon=btn_r_stick ] to temporarily sheathe your Blade and rapidly
move for a certain distance. You won't attack, but it has
many useful applications, e.g. when an ally needs reviving.
ZR Button Focusing

When Noah and the others spot something of interest,
you can hold [ML:icon icon=btn_zr ] to focus on that location. Something
special is sure to happen there, so try and get near.

When Matthew and the others spot something of interest,
you can hold [ML:icon icon=btn_zr ] to focus on that location. Something
special is sure to happen there, so try and get near.
Fostering Classes
Fostering Classes 2
Fostering Classes 3

If you go to Characters > Class and press [ML:icon icon=btn_zr ], you can
see detailed info on the selected class, including the
Arts and skills you can master by increasing its rank.

Classes are graded on a scale of S>A>B>C>D in these
areas: sword = offense, shield = defense, heart = healing,
chess piece = difficulty of player control. Keep it in mind!

A character's compatibility with a class is also graded.
Using a compatible character increases the CP gain,
making it grow faster, so keep this in mind as well.
Raising Allies

Approach an incapacitated ally and hold down [ML:icon icon=btn_a ] to
help them up and bring them back into the fray. This is
a special action that only Healers can perform.
Pluses of Freeing Colonies

Liberating a colony will enable you to access a wealth
of new information. Be sure to check every nook and
cranny to gather up all the rumors you can.
Canceling Attacks

Performing an attack the moment the previous one hits
allows you to "cancel" one attack into the next, making
them flow quickly into each other.

You can cancel auto-attacks into Arts,
and Arts into Talent Arts. Doing this speeds up
the execution, letting you deal more damage quickly.
Canceling Fusion Arts

Using Fusion Arts allows you to chain cancel multiple
Art attacks together: Arts into Fusion Arts, Fusion Arts
into Arts, and Fusion Arts into other Fusion Arts.
The Art of Flow

With "The Art of Flow" taught to you by Yuzuriha, you can
cancel Arts into other Arts without using Fusion Arts.
Successfully canceling fills the Chain Gauge slightly.
Characters in Danger

A red warning symbol appearing above a character
in combat indicates that they're in grave danger due to
low HP. Be sure to send healing their way quickly!
Rushing Back into Action

If you become unable to act in battle by getting Toppled,
Launched or Dazed, try wiggling [ML:icon icon=btn_l_stick ] and pressing [ML:icon icon=btn_a ]/[ML:icon icon=btn_b ]/[ML:icon icon=btn_x ]/[ML:icon icon=btn_y ]
quickly to hasten your recovery.
Save-Restricted Situations

You will not be able to save the game while your
controlled character is standing on a moving surface
or when they're falling.
Enemies Joining Battle

While in battle, nearby enemies can sometimes join the
fight. For your convenience, the number of enemies in a
battle is displayed in the top-right of the screen.
The "Continue" Option

If you select "Continue" on the title screen,
your most recent save data will be chosen
and loaded automatically.
Expanding Class Choices

Once a Hero formally allies with you, the party member
designated as that Hero's "Class Inheritor" will gain the
ability to assume the Hero's class too.

Other characters can still acquire a Hero's class
by fighting alongside that Hero or any party member
who has learned and set that class for themselves.

You can check how close each party member is to
gaining a class from Characters > Class. Filling the
character's icon fully will unlock that character's class.

The more members you have using classes you want to
learn, the quicker you'll be able to teach them to the rest
of the team, so take note of which classes you have set!
Player-Enemy Positioning

The arrow icon displayed above the Arts icons shows you
the position of the player character in relation to the target
enemy:  or  when to the side,  in front and  behind.
Setting Levels at Rest Spots

You can now use the Level Up function at rest spots to
lower your characters' levels as well. Doing so will net you
bonus EXP for any levels you choose to give up.
Ouroboros Talent Arts

You can use Ouroboros Talent Arts by pressing [ML:icon icon=btn_a ].
These have extremely powerful effects, but require the
Art gauge to be filled before they can be unleashed.

The Ouroboros Talent Art gauge can be filled by
canceling auto-attacks into Arts. To achieve a cancel,
trigger Arts just as the auto-attack lands.

The higher the Interlink Level, the easier it is
to fill up the Ouroboros Talent Art gauge.
Canceling Ouroboros Arts

Activate the Unlock Arts Canceling node on a character's
Soul Tree to enable the canceling of Arts into other Arts.

Canceling an Art into an Art fills up the heat gauge, but it
also charges up the Talent Art gauge and allows the Art to
come out quicker, making it an efficient source of damage.
Staying Informed

As the story moves forward, the information you can
obtain will also change. It's always worth revisiting
colonies to gain more up-to-date information.
Starting a Chain Attack

A Chain Attack is a special powerful technique that
allows party members to take turns strategically
performing Arts.

Performing combos, canceling into Arts and achieving
Role Actions all help build up the Chain Attack gauge.
Once it's completely full, press [ML:icon icon=btn_plus ] to trigger the attack.
About Chain Orders

Upon starting a Chain Attack, you will see three orders.
You can compare the completion bonuses to be gained by
completing each order, and choose whose order to go with.
Executing Orders

Select party members and hit with Arts to collect
Tactical Points (TP), with characters awarding different
values. Reach 100% TP or more to complete the order.

You can maximize bonus TP gain by using characters
with the same affiliation or role as the order, or meeting
other conditions, so try out all the different possibilities!
About Chain Arts

Completing an order triggers a Chain Art, adding
a powerful attack to the sequence, and ending the
Chain Attack round.

Party members can get another turn if you do well. You can
choose another order and keep the chain going if the chain
gauge isn't empty and you still have members who can act.
The "Fusion First" Tactic

Hold down [ML:icon icon=btn_zl ] and press [ML:icon icon=pad_right ] to order the party to prioritize
Fusion Arts. Do so and they will try to proactively fuse Arts
as often as possible.
Ouroboros Orders

During a Chain Attack, if you can complete orders from
both members of a given Ouroboros pairing, a panel for
their Ouroboros Order will be displayed.

Executing an Ouroboros Order will perform a spectacularly
strong attack, albeit at the cost of ending the Chain Attack.
Starting Ouroboros Orders

If you triggered a Chain Attack with an active Interlink at
Interlink Level 3, the Ouroboros Order will be selectable
from the very start.

In this situation only, selecting the Ouroboros Order will
not end the chain after the Ouroboros Chain Art, letting you
choose the order from the other one of the interlinking pair.
Merits of Ouroboros Orders

Selecting an Ouroboros Order will reactivate all expended
party members, and will not drain the Chain Gauge. You'll
also get Bonus TP from the combined Kevesi-Agnian forces.

Complete an Ouroboros Order to perform a powerful
Ouroboros Chain Art after the last attack.
Role Perks in Chain Attacks

Fulfill the criteria for the acting party member's role to
impart special effects that can aid your Chain Attack.

First Blood
Using an Attacker to make the first strike will net you
a large amount of TP.

Point Limit
Attacking with a Healer guarantees that the total TP
doesn't exceed 99%.

Back in Action
Complete an order with a Defender to reactivate
the character with the most TP.
Bonus TP

Using attacks that meet certain criteria, such as matching
the role or force (Keves/Agnus) of an order, will earn you
TP bonuses, which appear over the character's head.

These bonuses come in varying sizes, so get creative
and try out a combination of Arts and classes.
Order Ratings

Reach or exceed 100% and you'll be given a rating based
on how much TP you racked up during the order. From
lowest to highest, these are Cool > Bravo > Amazing.

The higher your rating, the more party members will be
reactivated at the end of the order. Try to earn as much
TP as possible and aim for the top rating.
Order Completion Bonus

Each completed order not only raises your damage ratio,
but also grants you its particular completion bonus.
Embrace their unique tactical advantages!
Overkill

Reduce an enemy's HP to 0 during a Chain Attack to initiate
an Overkill. Extra damage is then converted to a KO Bonus
that confers special rewards at the end of the chain.

You can choose whether to enable Overkills
in System > Options > Game.
Range of Defense Skills

Every Defender comes with a defense skill. Its effect will
be conferred to all party members within the blue ring.
This helps mitigate damage etc., depending on the skill.
Purging Rage Status

When enemies become enraged, their attacks get stronger.
You can use [ML:icon icon=btn_zl ] + [ML:icon icon=pad_left ] to set the party on the Burst combo
route - completing the combo will purge the rage status.
Auto-Battle

With weapons drawn, press [ML:icon icon=btn_minus ] to toggle auto-battle mode,
letting the player character fight and use Arts automatically.
(It cannot be used against unique monsters and bosses.)
The Screenshot Function

Pressing [ML:icon icon=btn_l ] + [ML:icon icon=btn_r ] lets you capture an image of the game
screen. However, unlike when using the [ML:icon icon=btn_capture ] Button, this
screenshot will be taken without the game's interface.
Destination Map

While confirming your current objective with [ML:icon icon=btn_y ], you can
press [ML:icon icon=btn_plus ] to also check a map of the immediate vicinity of
the quest's objective.
Giving Up

While in battle, you can hold [ML:icon icon=btn_minus ] to open the battle menu.
Select "Give Up" to abandon the battle and return to the
last landmark you passed by.
Benefits of Talking

If you see a  by a character's name, it means they have
something new to say. Talking to a person for the first time
will also increase your affinity with their colony.
Art Combos 2

When an enemy is toppled, you have the option of dazing
them, or instead launching them to continue the combo.
The full sequence is Break > Topple > Launch > Smash.
Powered Chain Attack Arts

During a Chain Attack, healing and buffs are applied to the
whole party, and positional Arts always succeed. Master
Arts will also be automatically fused. Put this to good use!
Ending Chain Attacks

When the Chain Gauge is fully depleted, or when there
are no available party members left who can act, the
Chain Attack will end, and you'll be shown the results.
Hero Orders

Heroes possess special Chain Orders that don't consume
the Chain Gauge, so they're more than worth your time!
Using the Soulhacker Class

The Arts and skills can be further strengthened by meeting
certain conditions. You can check these conditions from the
Soul Hack List, accessed from the Heroes menu with [ML:icon icon=btn_y ].

Soulhackers can change their role using the role skill.
Keep your party formation in mind and switch between
different roles as needed.
Browsing Tips

You can review tips that have popped up in the game
at any time from the main menu > System > Tips.
New Game+

Complete the game to unlock New Game+, a mode which
lets you start the game again from the beginning while
retaining the character growth of the selected save file.

Chain Attacks and Interlinking will have to be unlocked
by progressing the story as normal. Tutorial notifications
will be removed, but you'll still be able to read all the Tips.

You'll get to keep your full inventory as recorded in your
save data, but all key items will be reset, with the exception
of Origin Shards, The Art of Flow and Nopon Coins.

Unique Monsters that became graves will all be revived.
Beat them again to see records from your first playthrough.
Obtained Soulhacker Arts and skills will all be kept intact.
Setting Master Skills

As your class rank rises, you'll start to gain mastery
of the skills it wields. Mastered skills can be used
independent of class.

You can set skills mastered on other classes from
the main menu > Characters > Skills.

As you raise your level, you'll be able to set more
Master Skills, up to a maximum of three.
Hero Chain Perks

Heroes don't gain any role perks during Chain Attacks,
but they do each have a Heroic Chain perk that bestows
various effects if you meet the criteria.
Mio's Special Talent Art

Mio's Talent Art, Dominion Flower, is unique, in that it can
be used regardless of class restrictions. Use it to command
immense power that deals huge defense-piercing damage!
Stance-Type Arts

These Arts grant a special effect that will last for a while.
You can tell the effect's duration by the ribbons of light
around the character - it will continue until the light fades.

However, characters can only have one stance active at
a time, so be mindful - if you enter a stance while the last
one is active, its effect will be overwritten by the new one.
Master Art Weapon Switch

Arts and Talent Arts you mastered are performed with the
weapon of the class they belong to, and will assume that
class's weapon's stats (Attack, Crit. Rate, Block Rate, etc.).
Pinning Items

When you come across a dish or gem you really want
to make, you can press [ML:icon icon=btn_plus ] to pin its ingredients for easy
reference. You can pin one dish and one gem recipe each.

You can quickly check information on the pinned items,
necessary to make the selected recipes, by going to
Items > Pinned Items in the main menu.
Special Weapons

These can be equipped from Clothing > Attachments
to give your weapon a very special appearance.
(Usable class: Swordfighter only.)
Role Interlink Effects

When you trigger an Interlink, a special effect will occur
that depends on the character's role. This effect will be
stronger the higher your Interlink Level is.

Defender: Increases own aggro value.
Attacker: Deals damage to all enemies.
Healer: Restores HP to entire party.
Filling HD Ether Cylinders+

Collecting a certain amount of High Ether from
Ether Spheres will award you with a filled
HD Ether Cylinder+.

You can only harvest an Ether Sphere once all the enemies
in its vicinity have been defeated. The enemies you'll need
to defeat will be marked with an icon.

Once the enemies are down, approach the Ether Sphere
and press [ML:icon icon=btn_a ] to begin harvesting it.
Finding New Ether Spheres

When you harvest an Ether Sphere, you may sometimes
receive a hint about the location of other Ether Spheres
that you haven't harvested yet.
Ether Spheres on the Map
Ether Sphere locations are displayed on the area map.

To be precise, you'll be able to see Ether Spheres in
previously discovered areas, as well as those hinted at
while harvesting other Ether Spheres.
Reusing Ether Spheres

Once harvested, Ether Spheres will disappear, but they'll
reappear in the same spot once enough time has passed.
Note that the yield will decrease after the initial harvest.
Better HD Ether Cylinders+

Sunny and Cheerio's Nopon caravan, whom the party
assisted, is staying at the Fornis region's Namba Mound
Camp. You can improve your HD Ether Cylinders+ there.

Using improved HD Ether Cylinders+ allows you to obtain
more High Ether from each Ether Sphere.
Empowering Ino

Head into the main menu > Characters > Ino > Inoswap
to reach the Inoswap menu, where you can spend
HD Ether Cylinders+ to enhance Ino's capabilities.
To the Land of Challenge

To travel to the Land of Challenge, just approach the
portal by the Llyn Nyddwr Camp in the Fornis Region
and press [ML:icon icon=btn_a ] to interact with it.

Approaching the portal in the Land of Challenge
and pressing [ML:icon icon=btn_a ] to interact with it will take you
back to Aionios.
About Challenge Battles
Challenge Battle Particulars
Challenge Battle Rewards

In the Land of Challenge, you can test your skills by facing
a variety of challenges prepared by the Nopon Archsage.

Speak to the Archsage to see a list of challenges. Be sure to
check any special rules that may apply in a given scenario.
Once you're ready, give whichever challenge you like a go!

In Challenge Battles, your opposition will be fierce. Defeat
all enemies to win. A full party wipe will count as a loss.
Use all means at your disposal and aim for a quick victory!

There are three core differences between Challenge Battles
and normal ones. One, the time of day will not change
during Challenge Battles. Two, you cannot use auto-battle.

Three, the instant KO effect will not work on enemies. When
tackling the challenge on Hard, the following will also differ:
 - the "Invincible" buff will have no effect.

Completing challenges will award you Noponstone.
The amount will differ based on achieved rank, difficulty
and certain special conditions being met during the battle.

There's also a chance for challenges to be designated as
bonus challenges, awarding more Noponstone than usual.
Up to five challenges receive this designation at once.

Additionally, achieving a certain rank in a challenge for the
first time will award special items as a first-time reward.
Cashing in Noponstone

The Noponstone you claim in Challenge Battles can be
given to the Archsage's aides and pages in exchange for
various rewards.
The Archsage's pages trade in rare items.

The Archsage's aides can enable you to raise characters'
class-acquisition levels in return for Noponstone.
Ino's Class

Class: Noponic Champion - Role: Defender
Gains perks by evading attacks, rewarding skillful use of
evasion Arts. Also becomes stronger after getting KO'd.
Saving Party Formations

Press [ML:icon icon=btn_plus ] while in the main menu to access the game's
party formation saving feature.

Use [ML:icon icon=btn_y ] to save your current party formation,
or [ML:icon icon=btn_a ] to load a previously saved setup. You can also
press [ML:icon icon=btn_zl ] to see details of your saved formations.

You can also use [ML:icon icon=btn_zr ] to set names for saved party setups.
Template names, numbers and colors are all available to
make your favorite formations easily identifiable.

Using the right party setup for the conditions is especially
crucial when tackling Challenge Battles, so make good use
of this feature when aiming for the best times.
Crafting Accessories

At rest spots, Matia can craft accessories using
Enigmatter, which can be traded for in the Land of
Challenge, in the pages' shops.

Crafted accessories are different from regular accessories
in the following ways: 1) Their special effect is decided at
random. (Accessory type affects each effect's probability.)

2) In addition to the special effect, four potential basic stat
boosts will also be assigned. (Accessory type affects each
boost's probability.)

3) The basic stats that can be boosted are Max HP,
Attack, Healing Power, Dexterity, Agility, Critical Rate and
Block Rate. (Stacked boosts will confer reduced bonuses.)

4) Only one crafted accessory can be equipped
per character.
Enhancing Accessories

Crafted accessories have an Item Grade (IG) and can each
be enhanced to Item Grade V. Materials like Enigmatter are
also required for enhancement.

Raising the Item Grade will be beneficial, in that it
will both strengthen the accessory's special effect
and enable stat boosts.
Dismantling Accessories

You have space to craft up to a total of 300 accessories.
These cannot be sold, but you can dismantle ones that
you have no use for.

By dismantling an accessory, you'll get back some of the
materials you used to create and enhance it. Dismantled
accessories are gone forever, so choose carefully.

Deck your party out in accessories tailored to their needs,
strengthening the ones with useful special effects and
dismantling those that won't be of much help!
Crafted Accessory Effects
Archsage's Gauntlet

This mysterious space crafted by the Archsage's hand is
known as the Archsage's Gauntlet. The rules of battle here
differ slightly to those governing Aionios.

The Gauntlet is comprised of several stages.
To clear a stage, defeat all the enemies that appear.

Powerful enemies will appear at certain key stages,
and in the final stage. Defeat them and make it through
the final stage to reign triumphant.

You start each Gauntlet run by picking one member of
Ouroboros. By recruiting Heroes from the shop between
stages, you can assemble a party of up to seven strong.

Use your score in the shop to recruit Heroes and purchase
Emblems with special effects. Your score will rise as you
defeat enemies and perform battle actions, such as combos.

Recruited Heroes will use all the Arts they have access to,
but during Chain Attacks you'll only be able to use those
they have assigned to the Arts Palette.

The enemies and shop line-up for each stage will be chosen
at random. Purchase the Heroes and Emblems that will best
benefit you and try to survive the Archsage's Gauntlet!
Launch Charge

It's not possible to use Interlink in the Archsage's Gauntlet,
but to make up for this, you have the power to activate
Launch Charge by pressing [ML:icon icon=pad_left ].

By activating Launch Charge, you can send all enemies
into a launched state. The Launch Charge gauge rises as
you defeat enemies, and can store up to three charges.

Using Launch Charge will also trigger Bonus Time,
during which your score will build up faster than usual.
Attacks dealt to foes will also contribute to the score.
The Nopwatch

The Nopwatch is a feature unique to the Archsage's
Gauntlet. This gauge depletes over time, and when it
runs out, your entire party will suffer negative penalties.

The three penalties are greatly reduced HP recovery,
rate of recharge, and ally revival speed.

You can refill the Nopwatch gauge by spending your
score in the shop. Be sure to top it up before it runs out,
but beware: it'll cost more with successive acquisitions.
Events and Whimsy

An event may occur at the start of a stage. Events can
have all sorts of positive or negative effects, from rare
enemy spawns to extra enemy reinforcements.

Sometimes the Archsage's Whimsy will trigger when you've
finished shopping. You'll be forced to choose between two
options, which will confer one of many possible effects.

You can also use a Shuffle Ticket to change up the
options that the Archsage's Whimsy offers.
Gauntlet Differences

The Gauntlet's Chain Gauge is harder to fill than in normal
battles. Additionally, selecting a Hero's Chain Order during
a Chain Attack will consume the Chain Gauge.
About Lucky Seven

You won't be able to enter the Gauntlet in Hard mode with
Lucky Seven Talent Arts set, at first. The Blue Page sells
the Lucky Seven License which makes it possible, however.
Emblems

Emblems are items that will help to assist your full roster
of allies. Purchase Emblems from the shop and their effect
will be present until the end of your Gauntlet run.
Using the Shop

In the shop, you can use the score you've accrued
to recruit Heroes, purchase Emblems and refill the
Nopwatch gauge.

The shop's line-up is determined at random, but the Heroes
you can recruit will be limited to Heroes you've allied with.
Take on the Gauntlet after gathering plenty of Heroes.

What's more, if you purchase Emblems you've already
acquired, that Emblem's effect will be further amplified.
Emblems can be strengthened up to +5.

Strengthening Emblems via shop purchases is valid only
for the current Gauntlet run. Their strength will be reset
at the start of the next run.
Shuffle Tickets

You can use Shuffle Tickets to change the shop line-up.
These can be acquired by defeating fierce enemies at
key stages or rarely encountered "lucky monsters".

You can carry up to three Shuffle Tickets at once, and
the number you start each run with will increase as you
ally with more Heroes in the main game.
Getting a Score Bonus

If you complete a stage without any party members being
incapacitated, you'll receive a score multiplier. This bonus
will max out after completing five KO-less stages in a row.
Earning Score

There are a number of ways to increase your score:
1) Defeat enemies. 2) Inflict Topple, Burst or Smash
on enemies. 3) Defeat enemies with Chain Attacks.

4) Hit enemies with attacks during Bonus Time
(use a Launch Charge to initiate). 5) Receive certain
boons through the Archsage's Whimsy.

The following situations will add a multiplier to your score:
1) When successive stages have been completed without
letting any party members get KO'd. 2) During Bonus Time.

3) While the effects of certain Emblems are active.
Earn a high score and make your team the best that
they can be!
The Gauntlet's Depths

Congratulations! It seems you achieved Rank S in the
Pro Gauntlet. But Stage 70 is not the real end-goal...
In the depths, the fight continues until you reach Stage 140!

There are two differences from the battles up until now.
1) Enemy attacks will deal irreducible extra damage.
2) The "Invincible" buff will have no effect.

This ramps up the challenge to even more dramatic heights,
so be sure your party composition and Emblems are up to
the task that awaits you!
Cashing in Noponstone 2

Aside from item exchange, you can unlock and
strengthen Emblems for use in the Archsage's Gauntlet
from the blue Archsage's Page.

When you acquire a locked Emblem in exchange for
Blue Noponstone, that Emblem will be unlocked and
available for purchase from the Gauntlet shop thereafter.

You can strengthen previously unlocked Emblems too,
up to a maximum of +2. Once upgraded, they'll show up
in the Gauntlet shop in their already-strengthened state.
Matia's Class

Class: Lapidarist - Role: Healer
A combat healer who heals nearby allies on critical hits.
Can also set fields that heal users' HP on Art use.
Art Combos

Landing certain Arts one after another in a set order is
called a combo. Only Arts with special status effects can
start a combo.

For example, an Art that inflicts Break followed by an
Art that inflicts Topple will topple an enemy. Arts can
carry the combo path through Break > Topple > Launch.
Recharging Arts

In Future Redeemed, the mode of recharge for
normal Arts and the Ouroboros Power is fixed
per character.

The two modes of building recharge are as follows:
1) Agnian: Gauge fills with auto-attack hits and cancels.
2) Kevesi: Gauge recharges over time.

Normal Arts and Ouroboros Power always have opposing
recharge modes. E.g., if someone's normal Arts recharge in
the Kevesi mode, the Ouroboros Power will be Agnian.

By unlocking slots, you will be able to equip up to three
gems per person, each with a different effect, so be sure
to mix and match them to suit the role and play style.

Collectibles are items you pick up as you explore. You need
them for filling the Collectopaedia, finishing quests, cooking,
construction, gemcrafting and upgrading your X-Reader.
Cooking

Cooking and eating food at rest spots will grant you
a temporary boost to the rewards you obtain from combat,
such as experience points, loot, etc.

Your meal repertoire will expand as you obtain new recipes.
It's worth talking to people all over the place and tackling
quests to get access to new dishes.
Amulet Bonuses

In Bobobi's Shoppe, you can trade in Nopon Medals for
key items which automatically grant Amulet Bonuses. You
can check their status in Party Skills > Amulet Bonuses.
Performing Interventions

Across Aionios, you may encounter people and creatures
mid-combat. Approach the skirmish to automatically
support the weaker party. Win the battle to obtain spoils.

Enraged enemies pack a much harder punch than normal.
You can temporarily purge the rage status by completing
a Burst combo, available via certain Union Combos.

Additionally, a dedicated icon will be shown to indicate
enemies that yield items necessary for crafting.
Bonding Goals

In Future Redeemed, leveling up isn't the only way to
strengthen Matthew and his crew. Accomplishing Bonding
Goals and spending the Bonding Points they grant is another.

Bonding Goals are split into six categories, and are achieved
in the field and in battle. Achieving them grants Bonding
Points, which can be spent to empower party characters.
Exploration

Earn Bonding Points by discovering treasure troves and
locations in the various areas of the world, and so on.
Battle Missions

Earn Bonding Points in battle by defeating Unique Monsters
that inhabit locations around the world, among other ways.
Bonding Scenes

Earn Bonding Points by viewing events that can occur at
various locations in the world of Aionios. These let you
listen to the party's conversation while enjoying the view.
Collectopaedia

Earn Bonding Points by gathering collectibles in each area
of the world and registering them in the Collectopaedia.
Enemypaedia

Earn Bonding Points by defeating a set number of the many
monsters that populate the various areas of the world.
Community

Earn Bonding Points by meeting residents of the various
areas of Aionios and completing Community Tasks.
Ouroboros Power

In Future Redeemed, the right side of the Arts palette
contains a character's normal Arts, while the left side is
where you'll find their Ouroboros Powers.

Ouroboros Powers manifest themselves through
special Arts, which are significantly more powerful
than normal Arts.
Visions

A's Talent Art, Vision, has some special effects:
1. Enemy attacks will not affect the party for a set time.
2. The number of times you can use it per battle is limited.

3. While Vision is in effect, A's Talent Art changes to
Vanishing End, an attack which hits all enemies.

Like other Talent Arts, Vanishing End is also charged by
performing role actions. (In particular, using Light Field
will contribute to building the recharge.)

Vision is a powerful tool, but since its number of uses is
limited, take care to use it when you'll get the most of it.
Art Fusion

In Future Redeemed, the art of fighting with the power of
Ouroboros hasn't been perfected yet, but using Fusion Arts
summons the power to create an Aura dealing extra attacks.

The effects of the extra Ouroboros attacks will differ based
on the normal Art and Ouroboros Power combination. Find
your preferred pairing on the Arts customization screen.
Union Combos

In Future Redeemed, two party characters are able
to strike in unison to perform what's called a Special.
A paired set of characters is called a "Union pairing".

Hitting a launched enemy with a Special will trigger
a Union Combo.

Specials are charged by using Arts, with Fusion Arts giving
more charge than Arts used individually. However, every
subsequent Special will be slower and slower to charge.

Once the gauge is charged, press [ML:icon icon=btn_left ] to use a Special.
Use [ML:icon icon=btn_zl ] + [ML:icon icon=btn_x ], [ML:icon icon=btn_y ] or [ML:icon icon=btn_b ] to trigger the other Union pairings'
Specials.

Union Combos differ depending on the specific pairing
in terms of damage, area of effect, and more. Additionally,
they always inflict either Smash, Burst or Blowdown.

Furthermore, the two party members who perform one will
receive the Awakening buff. Use Union Combos at every
opportunity to make battles go your way!
Chain Attack Differences

You can now also use Chain Attacks in Future Redeemed.
When the Chain Attack gauge is full, press [ML:icon icon=btn_plus ] to initiate it.

Chain Attacks in Future Redeemed differ from the main
game in four ways: 1. Union Orders replace Ouroboros
Orders. 2. Accessories can change completion bonuses.

3. Accessories can set Heroic Chain effects.
(If none are equipped, these will trigger based on role.)
4. Each Union Combo used will raise the initial damage ratio.
Union Orders

If you can complete Chain Orders from both of the
characters forming a Union pairing in one Chain Attack,
a Union Order will be displayed.

Selecting a Union Order will end the Chain Attack, but
it will let the pairing perform their Special in return.
Union Setup

You can now customize your Union pairings. To do so,
go to the main menu > Union and press [ML:icon icon=btn_y ].

The combination of characters you choose will affect their
Union Skill and the specifics of their Union Combo.
Try finding the pairings that best suit your battle needs!
Bonding Growth

Go to main menu > Characters > Bonding Growth to use
earned Bonding Points to make party characters stronger.

Bonding Points are shared by the entire party. Furthermore,
only one tier of purchasable abilities will be available from
the start. Specific items are needed to unlock further tiers.

Try to consider the entire party's priorities as you decide
which characters to empower and which skills to purchase.
Strengthening Weapons

You can strengthen your weapons at Riku's workshop in
Colony 9. This will require gold and materials that can be
obtained as treasure, by defeating Unique Monsters, etc.
Enemy Initiative Arts

In Future Redeemed, some enemies will use special Arts
when they strike first, indicated with a special icon.

You can preempt these special initiative Arts by striking first
yourself, or luring the enemy into battle. Alternatively, they
can be interrupted with combos or reactions.
Enemy Strength in Numbers

In Future Redeemed, some enemies will have increased
attack and defense depending on how many enemies are in
battle, with a higher enemy count granting stronger buffs.

The enemies benefiting from this effect will be marked with
an icon. Try defeating other enemies first to weaken the
special ones.
New Challenge

A new Time Attack challenge has been added. Consider
paying a visit to the main game's Land of Challenge.
Na'el as a Party Member

On save files with the game completed, Na'el will be
a member of the party. Cutscenes will not be affected.

Additionally, Bonding Growth and weapon strengthening
are not available to Na'el. You can, however, customize
her accessories and gems like a normal party member.

Unlock Kits

In Future Redeemed, certain special key items called
Unlock Kits can be used to unlock Art, accessory and gem
slots and to raise Bonding-related character growth limits.

You can obtain Unlock Kits from containers and relics
found across Aionios, or as quest completion rewards.

The world contains enough Unlock Kits to fully unlock
all your characters, so it's a good idea to use them as soon
as you find them and keep getting stronger.
Character Equipment

Party characters can equip accessories and gems.
Accessories can be obtained from relics and containers,
and by defeating monsters and completing quests.
Enemies Hard to Beat?

If you're finding your enemies a bit too strong, you can try
gaining a few experience levels, or spending Bonding Points.
Be sure to look at what accessories you have equipped, too.

Alternatively, you can change the game's difficulty level
in the menu > System > Options > Game.
Use Vision
[ML:icon icon=btn_zl ]+[ML:icon icon=btn_r ]: Switch leader to A
Press [ML:icon icon=btn_a ] to use Vision

Having trouble with a strong enemy? Try raising your level
or spending Bonding Points. You can also take a look at the
Arts, gems and accessories you've got equipped.

Another option is to upgrade your weapons at Riku's
workshop. You'll find the necessary materials scattered
all throughout Aionios.
Enemypaedia 2

Monsters already registered in the Enemypaedia will be
marked with a [ML:icon icon=icon_enep ], while completed entries will show a [ML:icon icon=icon_enep_c ].
Unregistered monsters will not have either of those icons.

If you spot a monster not marked with either of those icons,
do try fighting it, and keep filling in your Enemypaedia!

Monsters that are higher level than you will be displayed in
yellow on the Enemypaedia screen. Those whose level is
significantly higher than yours will be shown in red.
Capturing Enemy Territory

Enemies occupy various locations throughout Aionios.
Approach enemy territory to begin a capture operation.
Defeating all occupying enemies will yield rewards.
About Shulk and Rex

Shulk and Rex differ from other Heroes in two ways:
1) Their classes cannot be learned by others.
2) They will not appear in event scenes.

Monsters are split into three categories: normal, elite,
and unique. You can tell them apart by looking at
the symbol displayed next to their level indicator.
Fog Rifts

Fog rifts are a special type of enemy that summons
Fogbeasts. The rift itself must be defeated to obtain
rewards.
Fighting Against Alpha

Alpha boasts a special status that makes him impervious
to regular attacks, but using your Ouroboros Powers can
shatter it. Focus on fusing your Arts to subdue Alpha.

If you're having a hard time beating him, return to Aionios
to raise your level and make the most of Bonding Growth.
You can also review your Arts, accessories and gems.

Happy Camper Gear

Now that you've obtained the Happy Camper Gear,
you'll be able to craft gems and cook at rest spots.
Cooking - Combat Streaks

A new meal effect has been added in Future Redeemed.
"Combat Streak EXP+" will grant more experience points
the more enemies you can defeat without leaving combat.

Defeating 10 enemies in sequence grants the maximum
bonus, and any enemies you beat beyond that will yield
the same bonus amount. It's a good way to grow quickly!
Adventuring in Aionios

Aionios is a great big world, with strong monsters lurking in
most of its many corners. Be sure to explore it thoroughly
and hit all the Bonding Goals you can!
Chain-Specific Accessories

Battle Manuals, Tactics Manuals and Strategy Manuals all
belong to a new type of accessory in Future Redeemed,
and they all have abilities specific to Chain Attacks.

They go in their own special slot, and change the effects of
the completion bonus and Heroic Chain. They're also more
potent than the default, so don't forget to tinker with them!

Bear in mind that you cannot own multiple copies of the
same accessory, so have fun experimenting with all the
possibilities that this feature opens up.

circles left and above of the active character's gauge.

You can press [ML:icon icon=btn_zl ] + [ML:icon icon=btn_x ], [ML:icon icon=btn_y ] or [ML:icon icon=btn_b ] to order the other
characters to perform their Special.
Collectopaedia 2

When you have Collectopaedia entries you can complete,
an icon will appear in the screen's top right. Remember to
fill up your Collectopaedia as you go to gain Bonding Points!
Field Crafting

Field crafting lets you use materials in your possession
to assemble useful structures that open up new routes or
make exploration easier in other ways.

When field crafting, you'll be given the option to either
"Repair" or "Construct".

You can repair structures that have ceased to function
by using materials to get them working again.

You can also use materials to construct new structures in
designated spots. Do note that constructing things from
scratch uses more materials than repairing existing ones.
Elevators

Once repaired in the field,
press the switch to travel vertically up or down.
Ladders

Once repaired or constructed in the field,
these can be climbed up or down.
Ether Slides

Once constructed in the field,
these structures project a rope made of ether which you
can then slide along to travel to higher or lower ground.
Ether Lifts

Once constructed in the field,
these structures project a rope of ether vertically,
allowing you to move straight up or down them.
Ether Masts

Once constructed in the field,
these give you information about any undiscovered
points of interest within a certain area.
The X-Reader

Matthew's handheld terminal is called the X-Reader.
It responds to signs of City survivor presence, notifying
you with sound and light.

When a signal is detected, a notification chime will sound
and one side of the mini-map will light up.

As you head in the indicated direction and get closer to
your target, the entire rim of the mini-map will glow.

As you get closer, the chime will become louder and
more frequent, so use those clues to find every last one
of the City survivors.
Upgrading the X-Reader

You can upgrade your X-Reader at rest spots. The upgrade
process requires materials, but the improved functions will
come in useful for exploration and combat.

In addition to scouting out City survivors, an upgraded
X-Reader can provide information on undiscovered
items and treasures, analyze enemy data and more.
X-Reader: Sense Analysis

Your X-Reader is now able to detect and display
enemies' sense types.
X-Reader: Treasure Sensor

Your X-Reader is now capable of detecting treasure
(containers and relics), notifying you with sound
and light.
X-Reader: Key Item Sensor

Your X-Reader is now capable of detecting key items,
notifying you with sound and light.
X-Reader: Weakness Sensor

Your X-Reader is now able to detect and display
data about enemies' weak points.
X-Reader: Arts Analysis

Your X-Reader displays information on your Arts to help
keep combat flowing smoothly. A special symbol will mark
Arts on the Arts Palette which are effective at a given time.
Bonding Scenes 2

You may discover locations in the world which can trigger
an "Bonding Scene". These allow you to admire the scenery
while your companions enjoy a little chat.

You can trigger an Bonding Scene by approaching its
location and holding down [ML:icon icon=btn_zr ] to start it.
Community 2

The people Matthew and his group encounter in the world
and build relations with are added to your Community.
Adding people to your Community grants Bonding Points.

The Community screen lets you see a simple profile of
each character registered there. You can also check the
details of their Community Tasks.

If you can complete all the Community Tasks listed there,
you'll be granted the opportunity to deepen the affinity
between Matthew's group and the other character.

Once you've unlocked the opportunity to deepen affinity,
speak to that character to strengthen your bond, changing
their icon in Community and granting extra Bonding Points.

You can press [ML:icon icon=btn_y ] on the Community screen to begin
tracking a character, showing their location on the
mini-map with an icon.

If the icon is not appearing, that means they're currently
impossible to track due to the time, quest-related activity,
or other such factors.
Changes in Colony 9

Completing certain quests will cause changes to parts of
Colony 9.

When a part of Colony 9 changes, it will put new features
at your disposal, sometimes allowing you to obtain special
items.
Nopon Medals

If you happen to find any Nopon Medals on your travels
across the world, you can trade them at Bobobi's Shoppe
in Colony 9 for some special reward items.

The items you can obtain at Bobobi's Shoppe have the
ability to increase the effects of your Amulet Bonuses.
Rescued City Survivors

Any City survivors you rescue will move to Colony 9.
If you happen to spot them there, stop by and say hello!

You may discover survivors even in places you have
previously visited, so be sure to search carefully.
Resetting Growth

Through having obtained the Growth Reset Kit,
you can now reset your characters' Bonding Growth,
refunding any Bonding Points you may have spent.

You can do this by going to the main menu > Characters >
Bonding Growth and pressing [ML:icon icon=btn_minus ]. You can do this as many
times as you want - the item will not be expended.
Strengthening Union

Each item you collect from the "Lessons in Union" series
empowers a particular Union pairing. A golden border
around the icon indicates pairings that are empowered.

Empowering a Union pairing increases the impact of their
Union Combo and the effect of their Union Skill. Be sure to
review your Union pairings after finding one of these items.
Where Quests Happen

In Future Redeemed, people and places where a quest
will occur are marked with an icon.

The icon will be visible both on the Area Map and
the mini-map.
Beating Enemy Groups

Attacking enemy groups head-on is dangerous. It's usually
better to lure away solitary enemies and defeat them solo.
Don't forget to level up and cash in Bonding Growth, either.
Changing the Weather

By obtaining the Celestial Compass, you've gained the
ability to control the weather when skip-traveling. To do so,
use [ML:icon icon=btn_zl ] and [ML:icon icon=btn_zr ] when selecting a destination to travel to.

cancel a standalone Art into a Fusion Art, or a Fusion Art

Using Soul Trees
Open main menu with [ML:icon icon=btn_x ]

To strengthen a character using a Soul Tree,
first select "Party" with [ML:icon icon=pad_up_down ], then press [ML:icon icon=btn_a ].

Characters are strengthened on an individual basis
by using the Soul Tree system.
[ML:icon icon=pad_up_down ]: Select "Characters" / [ML:icon icon=btn_a ]: Confirm

Now, switch to Noah's Ouroboros form
from the Interlink menu.

For starters, select the "Attack Plus" node,
which forms the base of Noah's Soul Tree.

You can continue upgrading the Soul Tree as long
as you have enough Soul Points (SP) to do so.

Once you've started a Chain Attack, you must select
whose order to follow. Select an order with [ML:icon icon=pad_left_right ], then
press [ML:icon icon=btn_a ].

On every Chain Order plate, there is a specified order
of role icons starting from the left.

Choose characters whose role icons correspond with
the ones in the Role Plate to deal higher damage.
Select a character with [ML:icon icon=pad_left_right ], then press [ML:icon icon=btn_a ].

Select the role icon that matches up to the one in the
Chain Order, and you'll get a tick. Don't, and you'll
get an X. Select a character with [ML:icon icon=pad_left_right ], then press [ML:icon icon=btn_a ].

This round of the Chain Attack will end with the
next character. Select the character with [ML:icon icon=pad_left_right ], then
press [ML:icon icon=btn_a ].

Completing an Order will activate a Chain Art. There
will be Chain Orders so long as there're characters to
select. Complete Orders to restore some characters.

Powerful Damage Bonuses

Drawing High Aggro

If you're not building aggro fast enough, you can use

Raise, Then Heal

Raised allies have low HP, making them easy targets.
Heal them quickly with healing Arts or a field effect.

Obtaining Bonus TP

During a Chain Attack, all positioning requirements are
lifted. You can inflict Break on enemies for bonus TP.
Select Noah now, and use Sword Strike to inflict Break.
[ML:icon icon=pad_left_right ]: Select Noah / [ML:icon icon=btn_y ]: Use "Sword Strike"

Earning bonus TP boosts the percentage significantly.
There are all sorts of criteria, so be sure to experiment!
Healer Chain Bonuses

to exceed 100%, the "Point Limit" bonus will trigger.
Select Eunie and score a Point Limit bonus.
[ML:icon icon=pad_left_right ]: Select Eunie / [ML:icon icon=btn_b ]: Use "Power Ring"
Defender Chain Bonuses

the Chain Bonus "Back in Action" will trigger.
Select Lanz and score a Back in Action bonus.
[ML:icon icon=pad_left_right ]: Select Lanz / [ML:icon icon=btn_x ]: Use "Heavy Charge"
Select the indicated Art.

Follow the on-screen prompts and select the

Positional Awareness

Using Edge Thrust from behind an enemy deals much
more damage than usual, so take full advantage of this.

To break an enemy's stance and inflict Break,
use Sword Strike from the side.
Raising the Interlink Level

The Interlink Level will go up whenever either half
of the Interlink pairing uses a Fusion Art.
[ML:icon icon=btn_zl ]+[ML:icon icon=pad_right ]: Issue the "Fusion First" order
Acting Out Orders

To complete this training, you must achieve 100%
on two Orders, initiating an Ouroboros Order.

Consider carefully which teammates to use if you
want to reach 100% on the second Order.
Instant Ouroboros Order

It's possible to initiate an Ouroboros Order at the
very start of a Chain Attack. Let's try that now.
Acquiring Bonus TP

Matching the role to the order earned you Bonus TP.
Bonus TP from combos will be added after the attack.
Link your Combos

Watch that the combo gauge doesn't run out and
try to continue the combo within the allotted time.
Watch your Heat Gauge

Don't let the heat gauge build up too high - the
Interlink will be canceled if you take too long.
Select the Indicated Art

Follow the on-screen prompts and select the
indicated Art to complete your training.
Right for the Job

Think carefully about which party members you'd
need to put forward to reach 100% TP.

Raise your Interlink Level

You need to perform the Interlink after raising the
Interlink Level to level three.
Stay on your Toes

After attacking with the Ouroboros Talent Art, quickly
start a Chain Attack before the heat gauge fills up.
